Explanation: Explanation: CMOS refers to Complementary Metal Oxide Semiconductor.

Question: 3. Propagation delay is defined as
Option A: a) the time taken for the output of a gate to change after the inputs have changed
Option B: b) the time taken for the input of a gate to change after the outputs have changed
Option C: c) the time taken for the input of a gate to change after the intermediates have changed
Option D: d) the time taken for the output of a gate to change after the intermediates have changed
Explanation: Explanation: Propagation delay is defined as the time taken for the output of a gate to change after the inputs have changed.

Question: 4. Propagation delay times can be divided as
Explanation: Explanation: Propagation delay times can be divided as: t(PLH) and t(PHL).

Question: 5. The delay times are measured between the ___ % voltage levels of the input and output waveforms.
Explanation: Explanation: The average of the two propagation delays is given by (t1 + t2)/2, which gives the intermediate value. So, the delay times are measured between the 50% voltage levels of the input and output waveforms.

Question: 6. Power Dissipation in DIC is expressed in
Explanation: Explanation: Power Dissipation in DIC is expressed in milliwatts or nanowatts.

Question: 7. Fan-in is defined as
Option A: a) the number of outputs connected to gate without any degradation in the voltage levels
Option B: b) the number of inputs connected to gate without any degradation in the voltage levels
Option C: c) the number of outputs connected to gate with degradation in the voltage levels
Option D: d) the number of inputs connected to gate with degradation in the voltage levels
Explanation: Explanation: Fan-in is defined as the number of inputs connected to gate without any degradation in the voltage levels. For example, an eight-input gate requires one Unit Load per input. ItÕs fan-in is 8.

Question: 8. The maximum noise voltage that may appear at the input of a logic gate without changing the logical state of its output is termed as
Explanation: Explanation: The maximum noise voltage that may appear at the input of a logic gate without changing the logical state of its output is termed as noise immunity.

Question: 9. Depending upon the flow of current from the output of one logic circuit to the input of another the logic families can be divides into ___ categories.
Explanation: Explanation: Depending upon the flow of current from the output of one logic circuit to the input of another the logic families can be divides into two categories and they are current sourcing and current sinking.

Question: 10. Fan-in and Fan-out are the characteristics of
Explanation: Explanation: Fan-in and Fan-out are the characteristics of logic families.

Question: 1. All input of NOR as low produces result as
Explanation: Explanation: All input of NOR as low produces result as high.

Question: 2. In RTL NOR gate, the output is at logic 1 only when all the inputs are at
Explanation: Explanation: RTL NOR gate behaves as NOR gate and the output of NOR gate will be 1 only when all the inputs are at logic 0.

Question: 3. ResistorÐtransistor logic (RTL) is a class of digital circuits built using _______ as the input network and _______ as switching devices.
Explanation: Explanation: ResistorÐtransistor logic (RTL) is a class of digital circuits built using resistors as the input network and bipolar junction transistors (BJTs) as switching devices.

Question: 4. RTL consists of a common emitter stage with a _______ connected between the base and the input voltage source.
Explanation: Explanation: RTL consist of a common emitter stage with a base resistor connected between the base and the input voltage source. The role of base resistor is to expand the negligible transistor input voltage range (about 0.7 V) to the logical Ò1Ó level (about 3.5 V) by converting the input voltage into current.

Question: 5. The role of the _______ is to convert the collector current into voltage in RTL.
Explanation: Explanation: The role of the collector resistor is to convert the collector current into voltage; its resistance is chosen high enough to saturate the transistor and low enough to obtain low output resistance.

Question: 6. The limitations of the one transistor RTL NOR gate are overcome by
Explanation: Explanation: The limitations of the one transistor RTL NOR gate are overcome by the use of multi transistor RTL. It consists of a set of parallel connected transistor switches driven by the logic inputs.

Question: 7. The primary advantage of RTL technology was that
Option A: a) It results as low power dissipation
Option B: b) It uses a minimum number of resistors
Option C: c) It uses a minimum number of transistors
Explanation: Explanation: The primary advantage of RTL technology was that it uses a minimum number of transistors. It consist of registers in large amount and it results as high power dissipation.

Question: 8. The disadvantage of RTL is that
Option A: a) It uses a maximum number of resistors
Option B: b) It results in high power dissipation
Explanation: Explanation: The disadvantage of RTL is its high power dissipation when the transistor is switched on by current flowing in the collector and base resistor. This requires that more current be supplied to and heat be removed from RTL circuits. In contrast TTL circuits with Òtotem-poleÓ output stage minimize both of these requirements.

Question: 9. TTL circuits with Òtotem-poleÓ output stage minimize
Option A: a) The power dissipation in RTL
Option B: b) The time consumption in RTL
Option C: c) The speed of transferring rate in RTL
Explanation: Explanation: TTL circuits with Òtotem-poleÓ output stage minimize the power dissipation and heating effect in RTL.

Question: 10. The minimum number of transistors can be used by 2 input AND gate is
Explanation: Explanation: The minimum number of transistors can be used by 2 input AND gate is 2 and maximum upto 3.

Question: 1. DiodeÐtransistor logic (DTL) is the direct ancestor of
Explanation: Explanation: DiodeÐtransistor logic (DTL) is a class of digital circuits that is the direct ancestor of transistorÐtransistor logic.

Question: 2. In DTL logic gating function is performed by
Explanation: Explanation: The logic gating function is performed by a diode network in DTL.

Question: 3. In DTL amplifying function is performed by
Explanation: Explanation: The amplifying function is performed by a transistor in DTL.

Question: 4. How many stages a DTL consist of?
Explanation: Explanation: The DTL circuit shown in the picture consists of three stages: an input diode logic stage, an intermediate level shifting stage and an output common-emitter amplifier stage.

Question: 5. The full form of CTDL is
Explanation: Explanation: The full form of CTDL is Complemented transistor diode logic.

Question: 6. The DTL propagation delay is relatively
Explanation: Explanation: When the transistor goes into saturation from all inputs being high charge is stored in the base region. When it comes out of saturation (one input goes low) this charge has to be removed and will dominate the propagation time which results as a large propagation delay.

Question: 7. The way to speed up DTL is to add a across intermediate resister
Explanation: Explanation: One way to speed up DTL is to add a small Òspeed-upÓ capacitor across intermediate resister. The capacitor helps to turn off the transistor by removing the stored base charge; the capacitor also helps to turn on the transistor by increasing the initial base drive.

Question: 8. The process to avoid saturating the switching transistor is performed by
Explanation: Explanation: Another way to speed up DTL other than adding a small Òspeed-upÓ capacitor across intermediate resister is to avoid saturating the switching transistor which can be done with a Baker clamp. The name Baker clamp is given at the name of Richard H. Baker, who described it in his 1956 technical report ÒMaximum Efficiency Switching CircuitsÓ.

Question: 9. A major advantage of DTL over the earlier resistorÐtransistor logic is the
Explanation: Explanation: A major advantage over the earlier resistorÐtransistor logic is the increased fan in.

Question: 10. To increase fan-out of the gate in DTL
Option A: a) An additional capacitor may be used
Option B: b) An additional resister may be used
Option C: c) An additional transistor and diode may be used
Explanation: Explanation: To increase fan-out of the gate in DTL, an additional transistor and diode may be used. Here, the fan out means the number of maximum output.

Question: 11. A disadvantage of DTL is
Option A: a) The input transistor to the resister
Option B: b) The input resister to the transistor
Explanation: Explanation: A disadvantage of DTL is the input resistor to the transistor and its presence tends to slow the circuit down. Hence limiting the speed at which the transistor is able to switch states.

Question: 1. TransistorÐtransistor logic (TTL) is a class of digital circuits built from
Option D: d) Bipolar junction transistors (BJT) and resistors
Explanation: Explanation: TransistorÐtransistor logic (TTL) is a class of digital circuits built from  bipolar junction transistors (BJT) and resistors.

Question: 2. TTL is called transistorÐtransistor logic because both the logic gating function and the amplifying function are performed by
Explanation: Explanation: TTL is called transistorÐtransistor logic because both the logic gating function and the amplifying function are performed by registers.

Question: 3. TTL was invented in 1961 by
Explanation: Explanation: TTL was invented in 1961 by James L Buie.

Question: 4. The full form of TCTL is
Explanation: Explanation: The full form of TCTL is transistor-coupled transistor logic.

Question: 5. The _______ ancestor to the first personal computers.
Explanation: Explanation: The KENBAK 1, ancestor to the first personal computers.

Question: 6. TTL inputs are the emitters of a
Explanation: Explanation: TTL inputs are the emitters of a multiple-emitter transistor.

Question: 7. TTL is a
Explanation: Explanation: Like DTL, TTL is a current-sinking logic since a current must be drawn from inputs to bring them to a logic 0 level.

Question: 8. Standard TTL circuits operate with a __ volt power supply.
Explanation: Explanation: Standard TTL circuits operate with a 5-volt power supply.

Question: 9. TTL devices consume substantially ______ power than equivalent CMOS devices at rest.
Explanation: Explanation: TTL devices consume substantially more power than equivalent CMOS devices at rest.

Question: 10. A TTL gate may operate inadvertently as an
Explanation: Explanation: A TTL gate may operate inadvertently as an analog amplifier if the input is connected to a slowly changing input signal that traverses the unspecified region from 0.8V to 2.2V.

Question: 11. The speed of ______ circuits is limited by the tendency of common emitter circuits to go into saturation.
Explanation: Explanation: The speed of TTL circuits is limited by the tendency of common emitter circuits to go into saturation due to injection of minority carriers into the collector region.

Question: 1. The full form of ECL is
Explanation: Explanation: The full form of ECL is emitter-coupled logic.

Question: 2. Which logic is the fastest of all the logic families?
Explanation: Explanation: ECL is the fastest of all the logic families because of the emitters of many transistors are coupled together which results the highest transmission rate.

Question: 3. The full form of CML is
Explanation: Explanation: The full form of CML is Current Mode Logic.

Question: 4. Sometimes ECL can also be named as
Explanation: Explanation: ECL can also be named as CML.

Question: 5. In an ECL the output is taken from
Explanation: Explanation: Though, the emitters of the ECL are coupled together. So, the output will be taken from collector.

Question: 6. The ECL behaves as
Explanation: Explanation: The ECL behaves as NOR gate because if any of the input voltages go high as compared to reference voltage, the output is low and vice versa for low input.

Question: 7. In ECL the fanout capability is
Option D: d) Sometimes high and sometimes low
Explanation: Explanation: If the input impedance is high and the output resistance is low; as a result, the transistors change states quickly, gate delays are low, and the fanout capability is high.

Question: 8. ECLÕs major disadvantage is that
Option B: b) ItÕs fanout capability is high
Explanation: Explanation: ECLÕs major disadvantage is that each gate continuously draws current, which means it requires (and dissipates) significantly more power than those of other logic families.

Question: 9. The full form of SCFL is
Explanation: Explanation: The full form of SCFL is source-coupled logic.

Question: 10. The equivalent of emitter-coupled logic made out of FETs is called
Explanation: Explanation: The equivalent of emitter-coupled logic made out of FETs is called Source-coupled logic(SCFL).

Question: 11. ECL was invented in _______ by __________
Explanation: Explanation: ECL was invented in August 1956 at IBM by Hannon S Yourke.

Question: 12. At the time of invention, an ECL was called as
Explanation: Explanation: At the time of invention, an ECL was called as current-steering logic.

Question: 13. The ECL circuits usually operates with
Explanation: Explanation: The ECL circuits usually operate with negative power supplies (positive end of the supply is connected to ground), in comparison to other logic families in which negative end of the supply is grounded. It is done mainly to minimize the influence of the power supply variations on the logic levels as ECL is more sensitive to noise on the VCC and relatively immune to noise on VEE.

Question: 14. Low-voltage positive emitter-coupled logic (LVPECL) is a power optimized version of
Explanation: Explanation: Low voltage positive emitter coupled logic (LVPECL) is a power optimized version of PECL using a +3.3 V instead of 5 V supply.

Question: 1. The full form of IIL is
Explanation: Explanation: The full form of IIL is Integrated injection logic.

Question: 2. Integrated injection logic is a class of digital circuits built with
Explanation: Explanation: Integrated injection logic is a class of digital circuits built with multiple collector bipolar junction transistors (BJT).

Question: 3. IIL has _____ noise immunity.
Explanation: Explanation: IIL has high  high noise immunity because it operates by current instead of voltage.

Question: 4. IIL is sometimes also known as
Explanation: Explanation: IIL is sometimes also known as merged transistor logic.

Question: 5. Integrated Injection logic can not be denoted as
Explanation: Explanation: Integrated Injection logic can be denoted as IIL, I^2L and I2L as well.

Question: 6. The heart of an I2L circuit is the
Option A: a) Common collector open emitter inverter
Option B: b) Common emitter open collector inverter
Option C: c) Open emitter common collector inverter
Explanation: Explanation: The heart of an I2L circuit is the common emitter open collector inverter.

Question: 7. In Integrated Injection logic input is supplied to the
Explanation: Explanation:In IIL, the input is supplied to the base as either a current sink (low logic level) or as a high-z floating condition (high logic level).

Question: 8. In Integrated Injection logic output is received through the
Explanation: Explanation: In Integrated Injection logic output is received through the collector.

Question: 9. When the outputs of two inverters are wired together the result is
Explanation: Explanation: When the outputs of two inverters are wired together then the result is a two-input NOR gate because the configuration (NOT A) AND (NOT B) is equivalent to NOT (A OR B).

Question: 10. IIL was commonly used before the advent of CMOS logic by company ________
Explanation: Explanation: I2L is relatively simple to construct on an integrated circuit and was commonly used before the advent of CMOS logic by companies such as Motorola.

Question: 11. Which company introduced one of the first consumer-grade digital watches (the Black Watch) which used I2L technology ?
Option C: c) National Research and Development Council
Explanation: Explanation: Sinclair Radionics Ltd introduced one of the first consumer-grade digital watches (the Black Watch) in August 1975, which used I2L technology.

Question: 1. The full form of MOS is
Explanation: Explanation: The full form of MOS is ÒMetal Oxide SemiconductorÓ.

Question: 2. What are the types of MOSFET devices available?
Explanation: Explanation: MOSFET are of two types: enhancement and depletion type. Further, these are classified into n-type and p-type device.

Question: 3. Which insulating layer used in fabrication of MOSFET?
Explanation: Explanation: Silicon dioxide is used as insulating layer in fabrication of MOSFET. It gives an extremely high input resistance in the order of 10^10 to 10^15 ½ for MOSFET.

Question: 4. Which of the following plays an important role in improving device performance of MOSFET?
Explanation: Explanation: In MOSFET, the threshold voltage is typically 3 to 6V. This large voltage is not compatible with the supply of 5V which is used in digital ICs. So, for the improvement of the deviceÕs performance the magnitude of threshold voltage should be reduced.

Question: 5. A technique used to reduce the magnitude of threshold voltage of MOSFET is the
Explanation: Explanation: Silicon nitride is sandwiched between two SiO2 layer and provide necessary barrier. The dielectric constant of Si3N4 is 7.5, whereas that of SiO2 is 4. This increase in overall dielectric constant reduces threshold voltage.

Question: 6. What is used to higher the speed of operation in MOSFET fabrication?
Explanation: Explanation: In conventional metal gate small overlap capacitance is present, which lowers the speed of operation. With the presence of self aligning property of the poly silicon gate it eliminates this capacitance.

Question: 7. Find the sequence of steps involved in fabrication of poly silicon gate MOSFET?
Option A: Step 1: Entire wafer surface of a Si3N4 is coated and is etched away with the help of mask to include source, gate and drain.
Option B: Step 2: The contact areas are defined using photolithographic process.
Option C: Step 3: Selective etching of Si3N4 and growth of thin oxide.
Option D: Step 4: The deposition of poly silicon gate.
Explanation: Explanation: These steps are the sequence of steps involved in fabrication of poly silicon gate MOSFET.

Question: 8. Why MOSFET is preferred over BJT in IC components?
Option A: a) MOSFET has low packing density
Option B: b) MOSFET has medium packing density
Option C: c) MOSFET has high packing density
Option D: d) MOSFET has no packing density
Explanation: Explanation: There are two additional steps required in the formation of p-mos transistor as compared to n-mos transistor. These are the formation of n-region and ion implantation of p-type source and drain regions.

Question: 9. Critical defects per unit chip area is ________ for a MOS transistor.
Explanation: Explanation: Critical defects per unit chip area is low for a MOS transistor because it involves fewer steps in the fabrication of a MOS transistor.

Question: 10. MOS is being used in
Explanation: Explanation: Since, more transistor and circuitry functions can be achieved on a single chip with MOS technology that is why MOS is being used in LSI and VLSI.

Question: 1. The full form of CMOS is
Explanation: Explanation: The full form of CMOS is complementary metal oxide semiconductor.

Question: 2. The full form of COS-MOS is
Option A: a) Complementary symmetry metal oxide semiconductor
Option B: b) Complementary systematic metal oxide semiconductor
Option C: c) Capacitive symmetry metal oxide semiconductor
Explanation: Explanation: The full form of COS-MOS is complementary systematic metal oxide semiconductor.

Question: 3. CMOS is also sometimes referred to as
Option B: b) Capacitive symmetry metal oxide semiconductor
Option C: c) Complementary symmetry metal oxide semiconductor
Explanation: Explanation: CMOS is also sometimes referred to as complementary systematic metal oxideÐsemiconductor (COS-MOS).

Question: 4. CMOS technology is used in
Option D: d) Both microprocessor and digital logic
Explanation: Explanation: CMOS technology is used in Microprocessor, Microcontroller, static RAM and other digital logic circuits. CMOS technology is also used for several analog circuits such as image sensors (CMOS sensor), data converters and highly integrated transceivers for many types of communication.

Question: 5. Two important characteristics of CMOS devices are
Option D: d) Both high noise immunity and low static power consumption
Explanation: Explanation: Two important characteristics of CMOS devices are high noise immunity and low static power consumption. Since one transistor of the pair is always off and the series combination draws significant power only momentarily during switching between on and off states. Consequently, CMOS devices do not produce as much waste heat as other forms of logic, for example transistorÐtransistor logic (TTL) or NMOS logic which normally have some standing current even when not changing state.

Question: 6. CMOS behaves as a/an
Explanation: Explanation: Since, the outputs of the PMOS and NMOS transistors are complementary such that when the input is low, the output is high and when the input is high, the output is low. Because of this behaviour of input and output, the CMOS circuitÕs output is the inverse of the input.

Question: 7. An important characteristic of a CMOS circuit is the
Explanation: Explanation: An important characteristic of a CMOS circuit is the duality that exists between its PMOS transistors and NMOS transistors.

Question: 8. CMOS logic dissipates _______ power than NMOS logic circuits
Explanation: Explanation: CMOS logic dissipates less power than NMOS logic circuits because CMOS dissipates power only when switching (Òdynamic powerÓ).

Question: 9. Semiconductors are made of
Explanation: Explanation: Semiconductors are made of Silicon (Si) and Germanium (Ge).

Question: 10. Which chip was the first RTC and CMOS RAM chip to be used in early IBM computers, capable of storing a total of 64 bytes?
Explanation: Explanation: The Motorola 146818 was the first RTC and CMOS RAM chip to be used in early IBM computers; capable of storing a total of 64 bytes.

Question: 1. BiCMOS is an evolved semiconductor technology that integrates two formerly separate semiconductor technologies those of the
Explanation: Explanation: BiCMOS is an evolved semiconductor technology that integrates two formerly separate semiconductor technologies those of the BJT and CMOS.

Question: 2. We use BJT in BiCMOS because of its
Explanation: Explanation: Bipolar junction transistors offer high speed, high gain and low output resistance, which are excellent properties for high-frequency analog amplifiers.

Question: 3. We use CMOS transistor in BiCMOS because of its
Explanation: Explanation: CMOS technology offers high input resistance and is excellent for constructing simple, low-power logic gates.

Question: 4. When was BiCMOS technology introduced?
Explanation: Explanation: BiCMOS technology was introduced in 1990s.

Question: 5. On which technology the Pentium is based?
Explanation: Explanation: The Pentium technology is based on BiCMOS technology because BiCMOS circuits use the characteristics of each type of transistor most appropriately.

Question: 6. The advantage of BiCMOS circuit is that it gives
Explanation: Explanation: BiCMOS circuits are particularly useful for logic with large fan-out (large capacitive load).

Question: 7. How many members a BiCMOS family have?
Explanation: Explanation: The BiCMOS family has mainly 5 members and those are ABT logic, ALB logic, ALVT logic, BCT logic and LVT logic.

Question: 8. What is LVT logic?
Option C: c) Lower supply voltage while retaining TTL logic levels
Explanation: Explanation: LVT logic is nothing but the lower supply voltage while retaining TTL logic levels.

Question: 9. What does ALVT mean?
Option A: a) All lower supply voltage while retaining TTL logic levels
Option B: b) ABT lower supply voltage while retaining TTL logic levels
Option C: c) Advanced version of LVT logic
Explanation: Explanation: ALVT means an ÔadvancedÕ version of LVT logic.

Question: 10. The full form of PTL is
Explanation: Explanation: The full form of PTL is Òpass transistor logicÓ.

Question: 11. CVSL means
Explanation: Explanation: Cascode Voltage Switch Logic (CVSL) refers to a CMOS-type logic family which is designed for certain advantages. It requires mainly N-channel MOSFET transistors to implement the logic using true and complementary input signals and also needs two P-channel transistors at the top to pull one of the outputs high.

Question: 1. Compatibility refers to
Option A: a) The output of a circuit should match with the input of another circuit
Option B: b) The output of a circuit should match with the input of the same circuit
Option C: c) The input of a circuit should match with the output of another circuit
Explanation: Explanation: The output(s) of a circuit or a system should match the input(s) of another circuit or system that has different electrical characteristics. This is referred to as compatibility.

Question: 2. The method of connecting a driving device to a loading device is known as
Explanation: Explanation: The method of connecting a driving device to a loading device is known as interface.

Question: 3. The first CML logic was introduced by General Electric in
Explanation: Explanation: The first CML logic was introduced by General Electric in 1961.

Question: 4. Commercial ECL families are not nearly as popular as TTL and CMOS mainly because they
Explanation: Explanation: Commercial ECL families are not nearly as popular as TTL and CMOS mainly because they consume too much power.

Question: 5. The key to propagation delay in bipolar logic family is to prevent the transistors in a gate from
Explanation: Explanation: The key to propagation delay in bipolar logic family is to prevent the transistors in a gate from saturation.

Question: 6. Schottky families prevent the saturating using
Explanation: Explanation: Schottky families prevent the saturating using Schottky diodes across the base-collector junctions of transistors.

Question: 7. The basic idea of basic CML circuit came from an
Explanation: Explanation: Since, this circuit has both inverting and non-inverting output. So, It behaves like an inverter/buffer.

Question: 8. The full form of MECL is
Option D: d) Both mono emitter and motorola coupled logic
Explanation: Explanation: The full form of MECL is Motorola emitter coupled logic.

Question: 9. Motorola has offered MECL circuits in ______ logic families.
Explanation: Explanation: Motorola has offered MECL circuits in five logic families: MECL I, MECL II, MECL III, MECL 10000 (MECL 10K) and MECL 10H000 (MECL 10KH).

Question: 10. The latest entrant to the ECL family is
Explanation: Explanation: The latest entrant to the ECL family is ECL 100K, having 6-digit part numbers. This family offers functions, in general, different from those offered by 10K series. This family operates with a reduced power supply voltage -4.5 V, has shorter propagation delay of 0.75 ns, and transition time of 0.7 ns. However, the power consumption per gate is about 40 mW.

Question: 11. All input of NOR as low produces result as
Explanation: Explanation: According to the properties of NOR gate, if all the input of NOR as low produces result as high.

Question: 12. In RTL NOR gate, the output is at logic 1 only when all the inputs are at
Explanation: Explanation: RTL NOR gate behaves as NOR gate and the output of NOR gate will be 1 only when all the inputs are at logic 0.

Question: 1. The basic building blocks of the arithmetic unit in a digital computers are
Explanation: Explanation: The basic building blocks of the arithmetic unit in a digital computers are adders. Since, a parallel adder is constructed with a number of full-adder circuits connected in cascade. By controlling the data inputs to the parallel adder, it is possible to obtain different types of arithmetic operations.

Question: 2. A digital system consists of _____  types of circuits.
Explanation: Explanation: A digital system consists of two types of circuits and these are combinational and sequential logic circuit.

Question: 3. In a combinational circuit, the output at any time depends only on the _______ at that time.
Explanation: Explanation: In a combinational circuit, the output at any time depends only on the input values at that time.

Question: 4. In a sequential circuit, the output at any time depends only on the input values at that time.
Option D: d) Both past output and present input
Explanation: Explanation: In a sequential circuit, the output at any time depends on the present input values as well as past output values.

Question: 5. Procedure for the design of combinational circuits are:

Option B: B. Draw the truth table such that it completely describes the operation of the circuit for different combinations of inputs.

Explanation: Explanation: The given arrangement in option c is the right sequence for the designing of the combinational circuits.

Question: 6. All logic operations can be obtained by means of
Option D: d) AND, OR and NOT operations
Explanation: Explanation: Since, the logic gates AND, OR and NOT are called as universal logic gates. It means that any operations can be obtained by implementation of these gates.

Question: 7. The design of an ALU is based on
Explanation: Explanation: The design of an ALU is based on combinational logic. Because the unit has a regular pattern, it can be broken into identical stages connected in cascade through carries.

Question: 8. If the two numbers are unsigned, the bit conditions of interest are the ______ carry and a possible _____ result.
Explanation: Explanation: If the two numbers are unsigned, the bit conditions of interest are the output carry and a possible zero result.

Question: 9. If the two numbers include a sign bit in the highest order position, the bit conditions of interest are the sign of the result, a zero indication and
Explanation: Explanation: If the two numbers include a sign bit in the highest order position, the bit conditions of interest are the sign of the result, a zero indication and an overflow condition.

Question: 10. The flag bits in an ALU is defined as
Option A: a) The total number of registers
Option C: c) The total number of control lines
Explanation: Explanation: In an ALU, status bit conditions are sometimes called condition code bits or flag bits.

Question: 1. In parts of the processor, adders are used to calculate
Explanation: Explanation: In parts of the processor, adders are used to calculate addresses, table indices, increment and decrement operators, and similar operations.

Question: 2. Total number of inputs in a half adder is
Explanation: Explanation: Total number of inputs in a half adder is two. Since, an EXOR gates has 2 inputs and carry is connected with the input of EXOR gates.

Question: 3. In which operation carry is obtained?
Explanation: Explanation: In addition, carry is obtained. For example: 1 0 1 + 1 1 1 = 1 0 0; in this example carry is obtained after 1st addition (i.e. 1 + 1 = 1 0).

Question: 4. If A and B are the inputs of a half adder, the sum is given by
Explanation: Explanation:  If A and B are the inputs of a half adder, the sum is given by A XOR B.

Question: 5. If A and B are the inputs of a half adder, the carry is given by
Explanation: Explanation: If A and B are the inputs of a half adder, the carry is given by: A(AND)B.

Question: 1. A multivibrator is an electronic circuit used to implement
Explanation: Explanation: A multivibrator is an electronic circuit used to implement a variety of simple two-state systems and two state systems are oscillator, timer, flip-flop.

Question: 2. Multivibrators are characterized by
Explanation: Explanation: Multivibrators are characterized by amplifying devices (transistors) and cross coupled devices (registers, capacitors).

Question: 3. How many types of multivibrators are?
Explanation: Explanation: There are three types of multivibrator circuits depending on the circuit operation: (i) Astable, (ii) Bistable, and (iii) Monostable.

Question: 4. Astable multivibrator is ________ in any state.
Explanation: Explanation: Astable multivibrator, in which the circuit is not stable in either state i.e. it continually switches from one state to the other.

Question: 5. Monostable multivibrator is/has ________ state.
Option C: c) One stable and another unstable
Explanation: Explanation: Monostable multivibrator, in which one of the states is stable, but the other state is unstable (transient). A trigger pulse causes the circuit to enter the unstable state. After entering the unstable state, the circuit will return to the stable state after a set time.

Question: 6. Bistable multivibrator is ________ in any state.
Explanation: Explanation: Bistable multivibrator, in which the circuit is stable in either state. It can be flipped from one state to the other by an external trigger pulse.

Question: 7. Bistable circuit is also known as
Explanation: Explanation: Bistable circuit has capability to store 1-bit of information. So, it is also known as flip-flop.

Question: 8. Astable circuit acts as a/an
Explanation: Explanation: Astable circuit continually switches from one state to the other. Hence, it functions as a relaxation oscillator.

Question: 9. In an astable multivibrator, the amplifying elements are:
Explanation: Explanation: Astable multivibrators are made with FET, JFET, OP-AMP or other types of amplifier.

Question: 10. Monostable multivibrator can also be termed as:
Explanation: Explanation: Since, monostable multivibrator is unstable and changes their states continually (It means that it can have both the states), whereas in astable multivibrator, one of the states is stable, but the other state is unstable.

Question: 11. The classic multivibrator circuit is known as
Explanation: Explanation: The classic multivibrator circuit (also called a plate-coupled multivibrator) is first described by Henri Abraham and Eugene Bloch.
